result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott C. Rinn

records.addlTxt: Hearing on November 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Cases called at 2:10 PM: 21CF1208, 22CF462.
Defendant Scott C. Rinn appeared by video, in custody from the Eau Claire County Jail.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson not in court.  Attorney Monica Fallon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Warrants quashed.
STC: 11/11/22 at 11:00 AM with Judge Barna.
Return on warrant on October 25, 2022 at 02:05 pm.

9:31 AM cases 21CF1208, 22CF462. All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom. Judge William Stewart for Judge Annette Barna. 
Prosecuting Attorney Angela Lynn Beranek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Robert Allen Thorson appeared by phone for Scott C. Rinn.  Defendant Scott C. Rinn not in court or appearing via zoom. State notes the defendant was present at prior hearing when this date and time was set. 

Warrant ordered.
Hearing on September 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

(2:29 PM cases 21CF1208, 22CF462 called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom. 
Defendant Scott C. Rinn appeared by phone. Attorney Robert Allen Thorson appeared by video for Scott C. Rinn. Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.
State advises the defendant will be entering into a plea to OWI 4th which means the defendant would need to enter custody immediately and not sure how that would be done via Zoom.
Court inquires how that would be possible to accomplish today.
Defendant advises was aware he would need to report directly to jail upon entering a plea and advises has not been able to get in contact with Attorney Thorson.
Defendant updates phone number with the Court.
Attorney Thorson relays defendant's email address to the defendant and confirms has the right email address and has emailed the defendant.
Attorney Thorson requests to schedule a new status conference.
Status Conference in 21CF1208 and Hearing in 22CF462 scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 9:30 am via Zoom.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights with Attachments
Notice of Pretrial Monitoring Program Termination
Plea hearing on September 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea hearing on September 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

(Cases called at 9:14 AM - 21CF1208 and 22CF462)
Defendant Scott Rinn appears with Attorney Robert Thorson.  Deputy District Attorney Angela Beranek appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense advises that there is an agreement in these cases, but that the Defendant is currently on probationary period at his job and does not want to jeopardize that as the plea would require an immediate report to jail.
Plea Hearing: September 9, 2022 at 2:30 PM (30 minutes)

Conditions: 
No acts or threats of violence.
Defendant allowed to retrieve belongings one time if accompanied by a law enforcement officer. 
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services.
Letter to defendant with amended signature bond ordered by court 06/06/2022. Request to return signed bond and Affidavit of Witness form to Clerk of Court no later than 06/17/2022.

Conditions: 
No acts or threats of violence.
Defendant allowed to retrieve belongings one time if accompanied by a law enforcement officer. 
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services.

Court order to amend bond and conditions of bond to remove the condition of no contact with S.L. or S.L.'s residence and add the condition of no acts or threats of violence. All other conditions of bond shall remain in effect until further order of the Court.
Proposed No Contact Provision Modified

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Attorney Robert Thorson at $100/hr.  Defendant shall reimburse Eau Claire County as follows: See prior order; new attorney to be appointed.

2:54 PM Cases called: 21CF1208 & 22CF462. Defendant Scott C. Rinn in court.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Scott C. Rinn.  Attorney Afton Lewis in court for State of Wisconsin. There is not an agreement at this time, but parties are close. 

Plea Hearing: 07/12/22 at 9:30am (1 hour)

Court finds that Attorney Thorson's appointment be extended to cover 22CF462 as well.
Notice of Assignment of Judge - Not Deliverable as Addressed (Unable to Forward)

Conditions:

(Case called at 11:10 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Scott Rinn appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Karl Schmidt. ADA Andrew Gunderson appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense waives reading of the complaint. Defendant updates address. Time limits for preliminary hearing are waived. 
Pre-Trial Conference: 05/02/2022 at 2:30 PM. Hearing: 05/23/2022 at 2:45 PM with Branch 5.
